00040 #ifndef _crossplatformexports_h
00041 #define _crossplatformexports_h
00042 
00043 /**
00044     @file crossplatformexport.h
00045     @brief This file is used on some platforms to determine what data should be read and written to and from a shared/dynamic library.
00046     @details Currently this file uses __declspec(dllexport) and __declspec(dllimport) on the windows platform to control what
00047     is imported from or exported to the Physgame DLL. If WINDOWS if defined then PHYS_LIB will be set to either "__declspec(dllexport)"
00048     or "__declspec(dllimport)". Every Class, template, function variable, and other item intended to be in physgame is tagged with
00049     PHYS_LIB. \n \n
00050 
00051     During compilation of the Physgame engine __declspec(dllexport) tells the compiler that a given item (a function, class, template,
00052     etc...), should be included in the dll and made available for use in games (or whatever kind of applicaitons use Physgame). This
00053     header sets PHYS_LIB to __declspec(dllexport) if EXPORTINGPHYSGAMEDLL is set. If Physgame is compiled using the cmake build
00054     provided then this is handle automatically. If the cmake build is not used, then this file will attempt to detect if the platform
00055     it is running on is windows or not. It is preferable that you configure your build environment to define WINDOWS and EXPORTINGPHYSGAMEDLL
00056     if you are compiling this on windows without the provided cmake build. \n \n
00057 
00058     Compilation of applications using Physgame __declspec(dllimport), tells the compiler what to expect from the dll and may make
00059     optimizations available with some compilers. This is automatically set if you use the cmake build, if you aren't this file will
00060     attempt to determine if you are running windows. It is best to set the build envirnoment of your game or applciation to define
00061     WINDOWS, if possible copy of our cmake builds for Catch! or the EngineDemo. \n \n
00062 
00063     The Macro PHYS_LIB is declared as empty if WINDOWS is not defined, as should be the case if LINUX or MACOSX is defined. \n \n
00064 
00065 
00066 */
00067 
00068 // Check for other nonwindows OS
00069 #ifdef LINUX
00070     #define NONWINDOWS
00071 #endif
00072 
00073 #ifdef MACOSX
00074     #define NONWINDOWS
00075 #endif
00076 
00077 //Check for windows, but not in a way that overides what is passed on the command prompt
00078 #ifndef NONWINDOWS
00079     #ifdef __WIN32__
00080     #define WINDOWS
00081     #endif
00082 
00083     #ifdef _WIN32
00084     #define WINDOWS
00085     #endif
00086 
00087     #ifdef __CYGWIN32__
00088     #define WINDOWS
00089     #endif
00090 
00091     #ifdef _MSC_VER
00092     #define WINDOWS
00093     #endif
00094 #endif // \NONWINDOWS
00095 
00096 //Used to define whether a class is exported as part of the shared library when compiled
00097 #ifdef WINDOWS
00098     #ifdef EXPORTINGPHYSGAMEDLL
00099         #define PHYS_LIB __declspec(dllexport)
00100     #else
00101         #define PHYS_LIB __declspec(dllimport)
00102     #endif      // \MAKINGPHYSGAMEDLL
00103 #else
00104     #define PHYS_LIB
00105 #endif  // \WINDOWS
00106 
00107 #endif
